Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money For Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MadStadRoyals1871
Reviews.Content: I'll get the very small negative out of the way, if you get a good deal on the internet the breakfast is extra and is overpriced, however there is a Burger King in the same building that is cheap! Everything else is a positive. If you want a clean, comfortable hotel about half the price of city centre hotels then this is the place for you. The area is light industrial, offices, car showrooms etc. We had a 3 night trip and bought a 3 day GVB public transport card for â‚¬16 that allowed us travel on the bus, tram, metro, the hotel is very well served for public transport and bus 48 goes to/from central station every 10 minutes, I believe there is a night bus service as well. We have even walked into the centre, so it's location isn't really an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Amsterdam...”
Reviews.Author: Kostas-Chania
Reviews.Content: The hotel was 10 mins by bus from Dam square, with a very usefull network fo buses every 15 minutes...also night hours had a 1 hour cycling bus to use.The bus stop is about 100m from the hotel..The hotel personel was vey kind and helpfull.Especially many thanks to Micaella, the Portugese girl at reception , who was prepared and ready to answer everything.Actually she was informing us for everything we wanted to know before we ask!!!!The hotel rooms were too clean and comfortable.The breakfast was also very good..I recomend this hotel for a stay in Amsterdam for sure, and i ll probably book again in a future trip there. Kostas, Chania,Creta,Greece

Reviews.Title: “Happy feat!”
Reviews.Author: Alok A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located slightly away from the centre but it is very well connected with the buses(buses every fifteen minutes). The bus stop is next to the hotel and it takes five minutes to reach the city centre. There is a Quick restaurant next to the hotel, so no need to worry about the food. The rooms are good. We got a room on the top floor so had a nice view of the city. I liked the quiet location of the hotel. Staffs were polite and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gillypep
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. We found it a very pleasant hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We arrived very early in the morning and were pleasantly surprised to find we could book into a room straight away. We never had an evening meal in the hotel so can't comment on that, but the breakfast was plentiful to set you up for the day. The hotel is a little out of the centre, but it's only about 10 minutes on the bus (number 48) which stops right outside. To be honest, when you see how busy the centre can get, we were pleased to be that bit away from the bustle. We did buy the Iamamsterdam card which we found very useful. A 3 day card cost 60 euros each but this includes entry to museums etc and all transport, including a free canal cruise. It did work out cheaper and is also worth it just to not have to carry cash everywhere. One word of advice if you're flying back from the airport - the queues for passport control can get very busy. it also took us 20 minutes to walk to the gate and go through security, so just leave yourself plenty of time. We would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for business....Depressing”
Reviews.Author: lnstphns
Reviews.Content: Small rooms. Weird space capsule bathrooms. Beds not too comfy. Boring location, nothing closeby, except Sloterdijk station (and offices). You can't walk into town, but you can get a bus easily enough. Clean enough, but quite depressing in general. Don't stay here if you are a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: noel57
Reviews.Content: a group of 11 had a great weekend in amsterdam in march 2012. we stayed at the amsterdam ibis city west hotel. the staff were very helpful with information on the hotel & amsterdam in general. the food was very good and the beds and room excellent. near the train station and close to the city centre, tram and bus pass the hotel front door every 10 minutes. would recommend this hotel and hope to visit it again.. noel, dublin.

Reviews.Title: “ibis amsterdam west”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: location is abit far off from the city centre.. but the help from the checkin desk was excellent and gave me directions and tips on the cheapest way to travel aroind the city. very clean and the rooms are fine enough size..

Reviews.Title: “Very recommendable hotel outside the city centre”
Reviews.Author: jwmpet
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at a four-lane, rather busy road, about 300 mtrs. from the A10 motorway. Bus 48, opposite the hotel, brings you within 10 min. to Amsterdam Central Train Station, which is also the start of the city centre. Hotelâ€™s neighbourhood is very dull with all kinds of commercial buidlings/factories. The hotel itself is much more agreeable, not the least because of the very kind staff. There are 180 rooms spread over 9 floors. Entering the hall you will find the restaurant and bar at your right and the elevators at your left. Only those who have an electronic key can use the elevator on the ground floor. Check in/check out went very smoothly. The hotel has a parking at 15 euro a night. The public parking in front of the hotel is free in the weekend. In the hall you will find an internet room and there is Wifi in your room, both are for free. We aksed for a double room at the rear by e-mail, and within one day we a got an answer that this was o.k. (room 714; the quiest room we ever had). The room is medium sized, double glazed and has individual air conditioning. The double bed has a very firm box spring mattress. There is a workiing table, a rather small TV with channels in many different languages, and a safe (no fridge or mini bar). There is an open linen cupboard for your clothes. The bathroom is a kind of cabin in the room. It contains a wash stand, a bath tub with shower and a hairdryer. Alas the temperatur of the water changed sometimes from warm to hot or cold. There is only liquid soap. Breakfast is abundant with several kinds of bread, cheese and meat products, 3 kinds of yoghurt warm pan cakes and waffres, but no scrambled eggs, ham and sausages. There are several kinds of juices, cereals, jams and a variety of fesh fruit. Coffee is excellent. We once had dinner in the restaurant which was of mediocre quality. The waiter is very friendly. Although the hotel is outside the city centre it is very recommendable. The bus to the train station leaves every 15 min. We made a pre-paid booking at the hotel at 75,00 euro a night, breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: kostaevi
Reviews.Content: we have just the usual experience when visiting an Ibis hotel. well standard,helpful staff at reception. not far from center,there is bus stop a few meters away and about 10 minutes from center. very good breakfast i will recomend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice for the budget conscious”
Reviews.Author: Nortcider
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for leisure purposes and consequently I look for value when booking hotels. This Ibis Hotel is definitely in the 'best value' category particularly when you take the price of hotels generally in Amsterdam. OK, it's not in the city centre but it is convenient to get to whether you're travelling from the airport or from the city centre. The rooms are clean and are of an acceptable size. The breakfast is also fine. The staff are friendly and efficient so all in all it's not a bad choice. I would have no hesitation in booking it again on a return visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “2 Nights at ibis in Netherland”
Reviews.Author: zaxwa
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located at lush green area outside city. Great hospitality and tasty food at restaurant. Take a deep breath in hotel room as it is located at calm place. Bus stop is near by and you can hire taxi anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, simple rooms, good value!”
Reviews.Author: PiperToronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in April 2011 with my sister in a twin room. The location is approx. 10 min bus ride from the City Centre depending on the traffic. I chose this hotel as it was the best value I could find at the time, accomodations are very expensive in Amsterdam. Rooms are small but adequate, very clean and modern though! The bathroom itself was quite small but the shower was large. I paid for using their wireless internet, it's been many months so I can't recall the price but it was reasonable, otherwise, I wouldn't have bothered. As long as you don't mind the bus ride, I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sigulda158
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very reasonably priced for Amsterdam. It is about a 45 minute walk through a nice park to the center of town or a short bus ride away. They also rent bicycles so one can get around quickly that way as well. Helpful and friendly staff. The only thing we disliked was having to pay for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to do better for price.”
Reviews.Author: budgetexpert
Reviews.Content: It's a classic chain hotel, so avoid if you can't abide them. However, the room was clean and comfortable, the buffet breakfast was included and the staff were amiable. It was also well connected by public transport as it was near a mainline rail station (if you are coming from airport you can get off before Amsterdam Central) and it was only 10 to 15 minutes on the bus, which was once every 10 to 15 minutes during the day, and once every hour after midnight. If you don't mind not being in City Centre you will do well to beat this place on price.

Reviews.Title: “good simple hotel at remote location away from the busy city centre”
Reviews.Author: Xa4traveller
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in the business district close to the highway and the harbour. It is aprox 1 hour walk from Amsterdam central station. A nice walk round the 'sloterdijkermeer' green area and the former 'westergasfabriek' which houses serveral cafÃ©s, taverns, a cultural centre and a highly recommended 'bakkerswinkel' for an authentic breakfast/brunch in a former gas plant building. The hotel itself is modern, clean and offers you the ibis quality you can expect everywhere. Not a stay if you are looking for a romantic weekend, more oriented towards the businesses in the neighbourhood but it offers a good, clean, nice basic place to sleep. The bar seemed nice although we didn't spend time in it (after walking a whole day in the city we were more looking forward to a good bed). The only disadvantage of the rooms facing the street is the noise level which makes sleeping with an open window almost impossible. We stayed there because we had a coupon for the hotel but I wouldn't book it myself. A little to far away from the city although the price is very attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Small cozy room”
Reviews.Author: RoxanneUS
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in July for the Sensation White event. Rooms are small but nice! 15min bus / taxi ride to center city. Staff was nice. Burger king next door - very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommendable”
Reviews.Author: jayasish
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights with my wife and we both were very happy about that; staff were very helpful specially the reception;room were clean and comfortable; the location is also very good as we could go to main amsterdam city centre by bus in 15-20 minutes; also you can go to another train station in the other side by bus;bus stoppage is almost in front of hotel;they allowed to keep my luggage in hotel after check out without any charge; I will recommend everyone ;

Reviews.Title: “Regulat Ibis Hotel (two-star standard) with helpful front staff and fairly good location.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Right afer check-in I requested room change due to cigarette smell in my room (non-smoking one). My request was accommodated immediately with smile and apology. My room was old-Ibis-style decorated, probably awaiting re-decoration to the new Ibis-style. Although located in office/industrial part of the city the hotel is fairly well connected by public transport - 10 min walking distance from Amsterdam Sloterdijk train station where direct trains to Schiphol Airport operate. At the Hotel there is also 48 bus stop (Kabelweg) - the bus takes you to Central Train station within 8-10 minutes. I didn't use hotel restaurant so I have no comment on it. The only other food providers around are: Burger King located in the Hotel building and herring sandwich kiosk located opposite side of the street. Generally I recommend this hotel for leisure stay aiming at exploring Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Heinrich M
Reviews.Content: Value for money as with all Ibis Hotels. Added benefit of a Burger King next door to it. Our room had a dirty looking carpet and old spider-webs in the corners, but not anything to be concerned about. Problems arose at breakfast with large tour-groups having breakfast. The space and amenities were not sufficient. At check-out got a nasty surprise with our laundry bill, an extra bill was added to our account. They did promise to sort it out though. Close to Sloterdijk station, Metro station and two bus stops, all just a walk away. Also bicycles for rent at the Ibis Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Glad to have given it another go”
Reviews.Author: Anon_Brit99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a number of years ago and had not been overly impressed. However, on this occasion i was very happy. The room is small but well apportioned, and has everything you need for a short stay at a low cost. WIreless internet was only 4 euro for 24 hours (or 1 hour free per day) and was quick and easy. I foudn the staff on check-in and out to be very friendly, which is not always the case in a hotel of this level, so that was a very positive thing. As others have mentioned, the location is out of town, in a business area. Not a problem for me, but annoying for some I would think. That said the bus gos into central station from outside adn sloterdijk station is a 5 minute walk away which has trains, trams, metro, and bus station (as well as a supermarket, chemist, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent home base for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ArkBear
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxury hotel, but it's clean, well appointed and blessed with a very helpful fun staff. It's also reasonably priced - really excellent value for money. They have, bless them, a bar and restaurant on site so you don't have to go far for a meal, they also have a very respectable international breakfast on offer. It's got all the services I need without being precious about them. But, the best thing, from my point of view, is location. 100 metres to the metro station, a bus stop within 50 metres which is on the night-bus route, so via public transport you can be in most any part of the city within 20 or 30 minutes. Oh, free parking on the street weekends and being a block off the Ring Road? Big plus. Its in a neighbourhood of office buildings - not particularly charming - but accessibility to the rest of the city more than makes up for it. I had a nice stay and will very likely stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fulyay
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel and it was very nice. There's a bus station just opposite the hotel and you can go directly to the Central Station from there. It takes only 15-20 min. There is bus service until morning. There is a Burger King beside the hotel. The hotel was clean, modern and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “just a chain hotel, but some advantages by staying here”
Reviews.Author: chitza
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights for business purposes in amsterdam. The experience was just the Ibis experience. The breakfast really basic, and one day there's wasn't even any fruit juice because the machine was out of service. Also the coffee is coming from an espresso machine - self service - it takes ages to get a coffee. The good points about staying in this hotel: - public parking space in front which is very cheap compared to the hotel parking or city parkings - easy access to heart of the city by bus, which stops in front of the entrance. I would consider staying here again because of these pro's

Reviews.Title: “Better option than the city centre if you don't mind the bus”
Reviews.Author: BrightShinyThings
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at Easter as part of a DFDS long (or shold that be lost?) weekend trip from Newcastle. As the rest of the ferry consisted mainly of stag & hen parties - as is the norm - they would've hated this hotel for the location. We much preferred it. About a 20 min bus ride from the centre of Amsterdam with fairly regular services, friendly staff and a nice little outside area for drinks/snacks. It was nice to retreat to from the non-stop hustle & bustle of a day in the 'dam. Wouldn't stay for more than a couple of nights as the bus journey would become tedious, and the waiting staff in the cafe did become very confused by an order of two sandwiches and one chips which was mildly irritating after the first 30 minutes, but overall the hotel was as you'd expect from Ibis everywhere; perfectly fine and in a quiet location. No free wi-fi but there's a Burger King next door so go there to cheat the charges. Do bear in mind this is located in the business district, so there are no real local bars or anything else of interest, and nothing pretty to look at out of the window, but it's perfectly serviceable and if, like us, you know you're heading back on 'the boat' back to North Shields, it's actually a welcome relief to stay somewhere where you can get some uniterrupted kip before the madness starts again! No problem at all with the rooms as others have reported, generally we found it to be as we'd hoped, perfectly servicable.

Reviews.Title: “wheelchair traveller”
Reviews.Author: ioannis94 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very spaciusroom and bathroom with roll in shower ,the staff was very helpfull and the location was close to the city exits for day trips and close enough to city center with the bus stop just outside i will definately recomend it

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: unoSpain
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights with my wife and 10 years daughter. I had reserved a standard-room for us in ibis web-site and there I marked my daughter as 10 years. Everything seemed OK but at the hotel they told us that a standard-room wasn't suitable for a girl 10 years, only for little children. They looked for a triple, but there were any left. They offered us to put a mattres in the floor or to look in another Ibis hotel, and as we were tired, we stayed there. I must say people at reception were very kind and friendly and the wrong thing comes directly from Ibis web-site, allowing you reservations like mine. The hotel: easy to/from airport (two train stops), clean, and confortable (wtihout that problem with children) The bad thing: away from centre. You need to take bus 48, so you better buy a transport card. It's a good election if you get a good price for the room. If not, you can look another location closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “not what we waited for”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We looked for hotel with free parking - and that what was written, but parking costs money, location is bad, far from city, far from nature zone, we didn'tlike that hotel, wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Far away, so close!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel-SSA
Reviews.Content: Read many tripadvisor reviews just after booking. Since Amsterdam Public Transportation System is the best I've seen in a city this size (less than 1 million people), the distance to the city center is not a problem at all. Bus 48, as everyone said, stops in front of the hotel every 10 minutes during weedays and 15 minutes on the weekend, and leaves you at the central station, where half attractions are in a walking distance, and the other half is reachable by tram. With the same transport ticket you can hop on and hop off every veichle (bus, train, tram, metro)... the 72 hours cost 15,50 euros and, if you use it often enough, you'll pay less than 1 euro for each ride. Back to the Hotel, the room is Ibis standart - clean, new, safe, no luxury, no surprises, efficient at most - and the internet voucher is the cheapest I've seen in Europe - 3,95 euros per day - and the service is fast and reliable. The staff is friendly, both dutch and immigrant, the bar is good, there are a few 24-hours options that can be taken to the room if you get tired of trying the Burger King menu. I enjoyed my time there and surely would be back, unless I found a room at Ibis Amsterdam City Center (near Central Station) for a reasonable prize...

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times in the past couple of years and look forward to returning. It's on the edge of the city, so you avoid the hustle and noise associated with city-centre hotels. There are excellent public transport links: a frequent bus service passes the front door and takes you to Amsterdam Central Station in under fifteen minutes. Very helpful staff, and the breakfasts set you up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Rude receptionist and bad location”
Reviews.Author: pcarbella Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Traumatic! that's the word that describes my experience in this hotel. Far away from my expectations of accor hotel group. First we came, the fat female receptionist was very rude. I had my booking printed and confirmed, but she easily said that there was no booking under my name. I said that i have the booking confirmation and she said again that she didn't have the booking under my name with high voice and blame it to me. At the end she gave me a room while mumbling. I was so traumatic that i'm afraid to go back to the reception after that. The room was small but the shower space was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in Amsterdam for one night”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel, very clean and the staff pleasant and helpful. But we found the bathroom was a litle cramped, and the price far too high, especially to have a third bed in the room for one of the children. We couldn't afford to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Pelagia7
Reviews.Content: Very glad I chose the particular hotel. Rich breakfast clean rooms, friendly staff and only 15 minutes from downtown by bus across the street that always comes on time.

Reviews.Title: “Very functional, but away from centre”
Reviews.Author: Pri_Dres
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiancee were at Ibis City West in Amsterdam (actually is not Amsterdam) during 6 days last week. First the good things: - Excellent breakfast (breads are very fresh and thereÂ´s a lot of options in buffet) - Very close to subway station (Isolatorweg) - Very close to train station and bus stop - Calm area (good sleep) Bad things: - If you stay downtown for a night walk, be careful. We lost the last bus (after midnight) and had to walk 5 km back (1 hour) - Rooms were too hot (thereÂ´s no cold air conditioning) - ItÂ´s a commercial area (thereÂ´s no shopping, supermarket, drugstore, etc close to hotel - just a Burguer King) Cheers and enjoy Amsterdam (very lovely city)

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD. CLEAN, QUIET AND FRIENDLY.”
Reviews.Author: charlotte186258
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the IBIS AMSTERDAM CITY WEST hotel for 5 nights and would definitely stay there again. The hotel room was clean and spacious and well equipped. The bed was very comfortable and I had 5 very good nights sleep! The locality of the hotel is generally a buisness district which means it is very quiet. The staff were also friendly and only too happy to answer our questions. The reviews I had read before booking this hotel made me think that this hotel was a bit 'off the beaten track' but I was pleasantly surprised that this was not the case and could not be further from the truth. The number 48 bus (which operates every 10 minutes) stops right outside the hotel and takes you to Amsterdam Central Station in under 10 minutes which is in the heart of Amsterdam. To get to the hotel from Schipol Airport is also easy as Amsterdam Slotedijk Station is only a 10 minute walk from the hotel. If you have bags and do not wish to walk then the number 48 bus is accessible from the station and will take you to the hotel in a couple of minutes. My partner and I were very impressed with the hotel and its location and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and descent hotel”
Reviews.Author: rathi06
Reviews.Content: Ibis is a very nice and pleasant hotel. fancy this hotel if you want to stay for 1-2 nights now more than that. Pros: Cheap, Bus 48 drops just outside and 13-15 minutes to Amsterdam Central Station, Burger king is in the same building and opens till 12 so even if you are late no need to worry about food. Cons: No coffee maker in room, No jugs, Breakfast is very very expensive. Try some place for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, decent price but not convenient”
Reviews.Author: snootchiebootchies
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean quiet hotel that is easily accessible by bus #48. When travelling there from Centraal Station, the hotel is right in front of the stop immediately after the Kabelweg stop. The hotel is also near Station Sloterdijk so if you're coming from the airport by train, you don't necessarily have to go all the way to Centraal Station. Just get off the train at Sloterdijk and take bus #48 towards Centraal and it'll make for a much more convenient and less chaotic trip. Now about the hotel itself, it is not conveniently located, and it's a cramped room, even by European standards. But it is clean, quiet and the beds were comfortable. And of course, the price is very reasonable. But we did not like the Ikea-ish pod-like bathroom. I'm not that big of a guy and I even found the shower way too small to manoeuver in. I can't imagine how a big or overweight man would be able to have a decent shower. We stayed two nights here and on the final night we stayed at a 4-star hotel right in the city center. If I were to travel to Amsterdam again, I would definitely spend the few extra dollars for a more conveniently located hotel. Amsterdam is such a walkable city that we found it very nice to be able to take a break or refresh ourselves in our hotel room whenever we wanted. With the Ibis West hote, that was not possible because it required us to walk back to Centraal Station to take the 12 to 15 minute bus ride. One decent thing I liked about the hotel were the very reasonable rates to use their PCs/internet. It was 1 Euro per 12 minutes. Not great compared to internet cafes in the city but very reasonable by hotel standards.

Reviews.Title: “Good for sleep not for nightlife”
Reviews.Author: wahrheitssucher
Reviews.Content: Rather basic but clean and adequate. Friendly hotel staff. Located in industrial area. But it was easy to get to the train stop and only two stops on the Sbahn from the Hauptbahnhof...there were bars and restaurants nearby that were so convenient on our first night getting into the city. Also, free street parking was a plus. Taxi from city-center costs about 20 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MicandTez
Reviews.Content: Cannot find a fault except, how do they justify â‚¬15 each for breakfast and having to pay to park on the street?

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean and consistent”
Reviews.Author: satori00
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly acceptable accomodation at a reasonable rate. The hotel's location away from the city center is not a problem - a bus stops right outside the hotel that runs very regularly; I never had to wait more than 10 minutes or so for it. I actually preferred staying there away from the chaos of downtown Amsterdam. The bed could use new pillows and did not smell that fresh, and the cost of breakfast was expensive at 15 Euros, but other than that I have no complaints about this hotel. The front desk staff was very professional and pleasant. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming hotel - quiet and clean, A+ to the front staff”
Reviews.Author: wesleywoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in July 2010 and had two rooms. If you've ever been to an Ibis hotel, you know what to expect. This hotel conforms to the Ibis standand, a no frills economic hotel with good service and clean rooms. We never had a single problem here. Check-in and check-out was smooth and the front desk was accommodating with any questions we had about the city. Our flight landed at 8AM and by the time we got to the hotel (walked from the train station, about 15 minutes), we were able to check in right away. The hotel is in what seems to be a business district so it's a bit out of the way, but the 48 bus goes to the centre of Amsterdam in about 10 minutes. The only issue that might arise with the location is that there are no food places around except a Burger King attached to the building. However, this wasn't so much a problem for us as we were usually out in the city for lunch and dinner and would come back late at night. Be aware though, after midnight you have to take the night bus which runs every half hour and takes two or three times as long because it goes through other parts of the city first. On the bright side, the hotel is very quiet because of its location so you'll be able to get a good nights sleep. I read in another review that the hotel does not have A/C. This is false. However, when the ventilation is turned on, it automatically defaults to 22 degrees, as one of the workers at the front desk told me. It isn't possible to make it cooler, but it's alright. You can open the window for a little bit of air. We used the internet in the lobby a few times. It's pay per use, 5 euros for an hour but you can put in as little as you want. Usually we put in 1 euro for 12 minutes, good enough to check any emails. We never tried the breakfast as it is quite expensive at 15 euro per person so I can't comment on it. Overall, I would stay here again. The service was excellent and it is a cheaper option than many other places within the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, Comfortable and Accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: alwayssuperstylin
Reviews.Content: The front office staff was excellent. They help you with just about everything, itâ€™s 5 star concierge service in a budget hotel. The rooms are super clean and the bathroom is very funky. The summer can be a little knotty because there is no air-conditioning in the rooms. But it was never unpleasant. Breakfast is quite good for what you pay. Hotel is located quite close to the city, itâ€™s a short bus ride. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: gangadhar13
Reviews.Content: Budget hotel with compact rooms. We were there a day before Queen's day celebration. And this hotel was almost full. I would not recommend this hotel for family as there is hardly any place to keep our lugagge.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, maybe the best Ibis.”
Reviews.Author: pr_filomeno
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to be reached when you came to Amsterdam by car since it is located near the ring. The hotel looks new, all equipment were in excellent conditions, very clean and confortable rooms. Good shower and beds. The negative issue is the breakfast, very expensive with the same quality of other Ibis I stayed during my trip. Maybe because there is nothing near to have a breakfast. Better to stay the bus in front of the hotel and go to the downtown (15 min) to have a breakfast there. Very nice waiters in the restaurant. DonÂ´t forget to put coins in the park meter as soon you park in front of the hotel, in 2 minutes I got a penalty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: Rhydychen
Reviews.Content: We arrived by car in February 2010, and we greeted by a really friendly and helpful staff. The parking was safe and secure, if a little costly, but it was worth it. There is very easy access to the city via a frequent bus service throughout the day and evening, with stops situated close to the hotel. Breakfast was really good value, and always nicely presented., The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT”
Reviews.Author: hoblets
Reviews.Content: After a 27 hr flight in total, the Hotel was welcoming and the room clean and comfortable. Great bus service Bus #48 8 mins to city centre. Tickets from reception. Breakfast was great evryday and the staff really friendly. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: studly1_uk
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay in the hotel for 1 night as part of a 3 night P&O mini-cruise. The hotel is about 10 minutes by bus (48) from the Central Station. Buses run every 12-15 minutes during the day and evening. On a night, there is an hourly bus (348) during the week and a half hourly on a Saturday night. The bus stop (both sides) is just past the hotel. The room is bigger than what it looks on most of the photos. The bathroom is of a funky design and looks like a pod. The shower is more than big enough for 2 ;-) The room was very clean and modern. We were on the 9th floor and did not have a disturbed sleep at all. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and spoke good English. My only criticism of the hotel is that the price of the breakfasts is a rip-off at 15 euros per person. Burger King next door opens at 10am and has a limited but much better value breakfast menu. The main menu had a good choice and was of reasonable price for a hotel. Wifi is 6 euros per hour at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AHMAD B
Reviews.Content: location good for car parking and nice reception staff

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: IRISHYIDDO
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel 5 mins from Amsterdan central (take no 48 bus stops beside hotel!Rooms usual Ibis size which is fine.Good powerful shower.Burger King next door so perfect for snacks Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “First time to Amsterdamn and staying in an Ibis... Loved it”
Reviews.Author: itchard
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through DFDS when we booked the ferry across. Slightly out of Amsterdam centre, but I couldnt find fault with the hotel. I think the hotel must have been very new, if not, impeccable standards. Very clean, stylish and comfortable. Loved the room, simple but modern. Bathroom was very cool. Like its own little pod ! Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would recommend and would stay there again. I guess it is a bit of a shame about it being out of the centre, but I would not mark it down for that reason. Sex museum in the centre was a bit of a rip off. Bit of fun, but nothing much to report. Anne Franks house was fascinating .. Long queue in the rain ! But definately worth doing

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: mickli
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind staying out of central Amsterdam this is a good option for you. Only 15 min and 3.20 euros by train from Schiphol Airport to Sloterdijk Station and 10 min walk to the hotel. Our room was very clean with air conditionning, TV and safe box. The neighbourhood is very calm and safe at night. The staff is friendly and they'll keep your luggage if you want to go to downtown and come back pick your luggage before heading to the airport. Public transport is available by train (10 min) or bus from Sloterdijk Station to Centraal Station in the heart of Amsterdam. Parking is available outside.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: tubbuSg
Reviews.Content: Value for money

Reviews.Title: “Very good breakfast a rip off......”
Reviews.Author: Mrss2
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here recently on our way back from travelling round Europe. The hotel itself was fine very clean the room itself good value for money. It was located a 10 minute bus ride from the centre the bus stop was located just across the road (bus number 48) and cost 2.40 euros each one way. Really enjoyed Amsterdam itself we got a canal bus ticket which cost 40 euros this lasted 24 hours but you could get on and off as many times as you liked. The only downside to the hotel was the cost for breakfast at 30 euros (Â£26.00 approx) for the two of us we felt this was a rip off as it was only the usual breakfast you normally get in hotels. Also we had to pay 12.50 to park which was also a downside. Altogether though the hotel was nice and clean staff were friendly and in ideal location would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but far from city”
Reviews.Author: Horizon080
Reviews.Content: Me and wife been to amsterdam in may 2009 and booked thsi hotel from net as per internet it says near to city center , which was not exctally right. it was 6-7 Km from dam square and central station the only option was to catch a bus , tram or train station was very far place was neat clean according to standard of IBIS But their was not a single shop near by for buying water or any basic ammenities food was hard to get as we are indian and veg staff in hottel restra was rude and dont even want to put effort in understanding our needs veg sandwich can be prepared anywhere in 3 minutes but thsi guys dont wann put effort , the straight answer was no veg eat whtever is in menu Hotel is located out of city in induatrial area , which closes at 5 after that it feels like all empty and deserted stay in this place only if you can eat anything ( which also not less than 15 euro) if you are late night people , never stay as in night you will not get bus and taxi will charge minimum 20 euro i suggest that rather than saving 20-30 euor per day living in thsi hotel better stay near city , near central station

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: akaali
Reviews.Content: Located about 10 minutes from the city accessed by frequent bus service, this hotel was perfect for our purposes. It guarantees a perfect night's sleep in well sound proofed rooms. Although it is located on a busy thoroughfare, we did not notice. Reasonable bar and very attentive, friendly staff. Parking is bit hit and miss. Patrons are charged for the spaces adjacent to the hotel but there is an underground car park that we worked out to be better value, although it is costly either way. Adequate, functional sized rooms with big showers.

Reviews.Title: “Good chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: lbh3
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at Ibis Westcorner in march 2009 on a short trip to Amsterdam. I enjoyed the stay, and will recommend the hotel. Lots of parking space on the street and pay parking as weel, easy access to town center with bus 48 that stops 200 meters from the hotel, and the usual Ibis standard rooms. You know what you get. Tried the restaurant one night, and that was fine. Breakfast maybe a bit overpriced at 14.- Euro. Service at frontdesk fine as well, no complaint at all.

Reviews.Title: “VERY pleasant budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: zpherr
Reviews.Content: This Ibis is quite new and clean (both the room and common areas) and is very close to a train station, just 5 minutes away. So, no problem to find it. The room is well-organized, bright with a big window and spotlessly clean, so is the toilet which is with a very nice standing shower. The room is not big and I didnt find it too small to be uncomfortable at all. Bed was also quite comfy. The hotel is not located at the city centre and there is not much to see to do and see in the vicinity but there is a bus stop outside and you can get very good connection to the city just by taking a bus ride of 20 minutes. The breakfast was with limited choice but no complaints as I just paid for a budget hotel anyway. Overall, my stay in westcorner was a pleasant one and it exceeded my expectation. It is modern, clean and efficient and the price is comparatively cheaper. (I live in asia and find the hotels in europe are way toooooo expensive). I definitely recommend it if you look for a decent budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel - avoid it at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Skipleased
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this rubbish hotel last week. Two tiny rooms at Euro 125-00 each. You cannot swing a cat in the bedrooms - for a joke trying using the toilet and doing the necessary post toilet actions - impossible! We left after one night - we woken by the builders next door drilling and hammering at 0630 am. The building work starts at 0600 and finnishes at 10.00pm. You van do a great deal better elsewhere like the Novotel near exhubition centre.

Reviews.Title: “Feedback - Irish couple”
Reviews.Author: Veronica83
Reviews.Content: Reception was really helpful as much as they could, very pleasent girls. Room was clean and nice. The only one issue was that safe was not stuck to the floor, anybody could just take it. That was not safe at all, I would not leave there my passport or money. All in all we did enjoy our stay in Amsterdam. THX

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot!”
Reviews.Author: kimnmario
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at this hotel and it was perfect. It is a 10 minute bus ride into town and a 5 minute walk to a car rental, or 12 Euro cab ride - don't except 20 Euros for a cab ride from town- we got fooled the first time!. Food was excellent. Breakfast was included in our stay through itravel2000. Plus there is a Burger King in the building, perfect for those late night munchies. The only thing to remember is to eat in town or bring something back with you if you come back late because the Burger King closes around midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: AladdinLondon
Reviews.Content: Not a bad price, 10 minute walk from station, good for a short stay. Clean facilities, and friendly staff, I recommend it

Reviews.Title: “smart hotel.....but watch the 'parking space' outside”
Reviews.Author: steadsy
Reviews.Content: Really smart (but a little expensive) for an Ibis hotel, with a fabulous en-suite. Breakfast was a total waste of money. But be careful of the 'parking space' at the far end of the roadside parking lot as it is used as a sneaky revenue generator for the local authorities' Christmas fund...no signs/ warnings/ markings/ etc but a 50 euro parking 'fee' if you dare go up the kerb and into the welcoming space after a tiring 800 mile trip from the French Alps.....and did the Ibis reception warn us of it even though they are aware many have suffered the same fate? nope!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel786
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Nice, clean rooms with comfortable bedding and standard amenities. A mini-bar was missing but did not bother us. Well connected via Bus Line 48 from Central Station. The bus runs every 15 minutes on weekdays and also at good frequency during weekend. Staff are polite and helpful except for one incident on last day when the day reluctantly refused to sterilize the baby milk bottles.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: zailanz
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights here in Nov 2005. The hotel is very nice as the building is new, everything is clean and very comfortable. I was looking forward to a more traditional, history rich building and location but ended up here. The building and room design is modern, and the stay was very pleasant. Toilet was a bit small but for 1 person it was a practcal size. The water pressure is fantastic! You can really enjoy a good shower here. Location is not the greatest point of this hotel. There is pretty much nothing around the area as it is in the middle of the industrial area. There is a Burger King restaurant adjoining the hotel, but other that that there is no other place to eat. There is a bus stop right across the road where a bus comes every 15 minutes and a 15 minute ride takes you to Centraal Station.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: craigs007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights (15 of us on stag do). Its comfy, clean and modern. It is approx 15 Euro's in a taxi to Dam square or you can get a train which is a 5 minute walk to the nearest station for about 2 euro's. Unfortnualty the bar closes at around midnight so you aint got a chance of getting a drink or bite to eat after that. All in all a good hotel, but if you can be bothered with taxi's id recommend the hotels in Amsterdam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Good find!”
Reviews.Author: Kieran27
Reviews.Content: 5 Lads went for a 3 day stay. 10 minute taxi ride to the Red Light district.(5 seater cost us about 18 euro)The hotel is based in the industrial area but it is fine. Hotel is spotless, staff are friendly and efficient....towels changed each day, etc. No hesitation in recommending this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband and our 19 year old son stayed here over mid term break in a triple room. I was a little wary since previous photos on the review made it look dark and dreary. It was only a 7 minute(no 48) bus ride from Central Station(look out for the Burger King on the right) Buses are punctual, warm and clean.The hotel is in a business area so nothing to wander about and look at. Who cares about the view? The decor is quite contemporary. The ensuite is in a pod-like, curved room and has a great power shower! Exceptionally clean & bright.Cosy duvets , fresh towels and toiletries every day. Staff were very friendly and speak English. The only down side I can report was going for an evening meal and they had run out of some of the choices on the Menu. Otherwise I would be very happy to return and highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: thedonandcaggy
Reviews.Content: Just come back from this hotel, after spending 3 great nights there. The Hotel is great, rooms are spotless, nice bar, nice food and friendly staff. We had a triple room, which isn't massive, but it was fine for us. The hotel isn't in the centre of Amsterdam, but it's no trouble getting there. Bus picks up out front of the hotel, and costs 2 euros 40 for a single. You can get a ticket which saves you 30%, but we didn't in the end, it was cheap enough any way. It takes about 10 mins into Dam square. Last bus back from centre is at 12:15am on the dot. A taxi cost us 15 euros from the centraal station. We had a brilliant time in Amsterdam, and will definitely be staying back at the Ibis next time we are there. One more thing. There is a Burger king next door to hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Not central but new”
Reviews.Author: raffael24
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been built just one year before our stay. So everything was new and clean. The breakfast was very good! On the other hand it takes some time to get from the center to the hotel by public transport. If you have a car there is a free parking place in front of the hotel. But parking in the city center is really expensive. If you decide to take a taxi you must be prepared that it is more expensive than in other european cities. Some other things: The rooms were tiny. The area where the hotel has been built isn't the most beautiful part of Amsterdam. The staff was a bit arrogant. Altogether we may could have found a better hotel than this but we don't regret having stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Stag Weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and Twelve of my mates stayed at this hotel in August for my stag do!! I have to admit the hotel was first class and in an ideal location!! It is just outside the city centre (easily accessabile by bus or taxi) and also it is not far from airport either. It has a Burger King next door!! which is ideal for a hangover cure!! No seriously though, the staff at the hotel were very friendly + the rooms were fantastic, with excellent power showers!!! On each level of the hotel in the room corridors there are vending machines with snacks and cold drinks, very conveinient. A couple of my other mates stayed in a flee pitt in the city centre for the same price, GUTTED!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good 3star in the suburbs”
Reviews.Author: mowgli
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very new, very clean, very comfortable and safe. However it's not near the centre of Amsterdam - you will have to get the number 48 bus which runs every half hour (there's no way you could walk). If you are not in a party group and are unlikely to be out too late (last bus about midnight) and don't mind a 15 min bus ride to hotel from Centraal station then it's a reasonable choice as it's a fair bit cheaper than similar quality hotels in the centre of Amsterdam. Overall the hotel is a good quality 3 star and worth considering if you can get a good rate and just fancy a bit of quiet sightseeing in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We staid in this hotel three weeks ago and it was just perfect. We booked the stay via the net. We travelled by public transport to the city. Very easy, only a few minutes. Hotel is very clean and looks very modern and new. Especially the staff is very friendly. Perfect place to stay for a few days in Amsterdam. During weekdays not so much tourists, but only business people.

Reviews.Title: “hmm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: very clean hotel , friendly staff ...The rooms are fair , the bathroom is small but the shower is good . Small tv , big bed ...Overall it's average but the people are so nice and the food and drinks machine so helpfull after the munchee's that the hotel seems good enough

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, new public transportation!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in this very clean hotel. The hotel offers very good value for money. We came by car and the parking behind the hotel is free of charge. The bus number 48 is now running 7 days a week (from 15th of december) untill 23.30 hrs at nights. Busride is only 10 minutes to the centre of town (Central station). Defenitely a good choise if you would like to stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, wish it was more central...”
Reviews.Author: hedylarue
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the airport we took the hotel shuttle bus and were pleasantly surprised that our hotel was the first stop which took only about 10 minutes! The hotel is clean, modern and beautiful. The rooms are great and the staff was so nice and helpful. The beds were maybe the best I've ever slept on...I wanted to take the bed home! If you can eat in the city, you're better off as the hotel restaurant has very slow service, but it's a decent last resort as the food is not bad and there's no place else to eat around the hotel. The hotel seems to be located in a business district so there's not too much in the area other than buildings. During the day you may see a few people, but at night, it's completely deserted. We went back and forth from the city using the train which is about a ten minute walk from the hotel and Amsterdam Centraal is the first stop so you get there in about 15 minutes total. We didn't feel very comfortable walking back to the hotel later than about 9:30pm, but we never had any problems. I love the hotel itself, but if you want to stay out very late and you're not with a big group you may want to be in the center.

Reviews.Title: “friendly reception staff, clean rooms, not too bad!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and new and clean, - the bathrooms are lovely although small! The showers are nice and spacious and really strong - like having a massage every morning!! The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The bar staff were slow and not very helpful....so we made sure we didn't spend too much time there! The breakfast left a LOT to be desired. There was never any egg left, the croissants were hard and cold, - you' be better off staying in bed! We found the transport ok - we never used the buses - we used the metro "Isorlatorweg" station behind the hotel to go the one stop into "Sloterdijk" (from here you catch the train to the airport) and its one more stop on the train from Sloterdijk to Amsterdam Centraal. - Nice and easy, and nice to stay in a quiet area. If you're looking for nightlife around your hotel this is not the place to stay! - All there is in the vicinity of the hotel is a Burger King!

Reviews.Title: “No such a good deal”
Reviews.Author: axltope
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the weekend of 22nd October , the hotel is fine like all other Ibis around Europe with cheap prices for a brand new modern room but the main problem is Location because the bus stop that is just in front of hotel's door(line 48) just works working days 'til 18:00h.....so on weekends you need to go downtown by metro around the corner but ( 1 every 20min) + train(every 10min), total trip must be around 25 minutes but you have to pay metro (ticket 1,80â‚¬) plus train (ticket 3.2â‚¬) so at the end of weekend you waste a lot of money and time that may be would have been better expended paying a more expensive but central located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Ibis”
Reviews.Author: minsagin
Reviews.Content: Modern new hotel on the outskirts of Amsterdam. Situted in an industrial area. Good cheap clean accommodation with excellent shower facilities. Had booked a twin room and despite checking on this beforehand had been allocated a double room. This was rectified by very pleasant front line staff member. I wonder if the restaurant and breakfast facilities are up to coping with the amount of rooms. Breakfast was quite a fraught affair although the restaraunt is run by a very friendly spanish lady. OK for a one night stay unless you like the Ibis chain.

Reviews.Title: “Good Night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis Westcorner for one night on July 27, 2004. The rooms are nice with a very unique bathroom. The rooms have air conditioning, which is a must on a hot humid day in amsterdam. The hotel is about 10 minutes from central station and is easily reached by bus # 48. The bus only runs till p.m., so you will need to take the train to get back to the hotel. The price was right and the room was good.

HotelInfo.Name: Ibis Amsterdam City West
HotelInfo.Address: Transformatorweg 36, Amsterdam 1014 AK, The Netherlands
